results.title: Mopokes in action
results.brief_description: A scout training film showing the patrol system at work. The activities of a patrol, “The Mopokes”, including a weekly patrol meeting, a patrol outing and a patrol camp. The broadening of the patrol leader’s outlook is shown by his trip to a jamboree and his ability to help his patrol by virtue of having gained his 1st Class badge. How the patrol system offers the Scoutmaster the opportunity of developing leadership in boys.

results.title: Mooti: child of New India
results.creator_credit: Atlantis Productions and J. Michael Hagopian
results.brief_description: The story of a Hindu village boy who plays a part in a changing India. Through Mooti’s eyes are presented the three major concepts of the film: change to new tools, change to new industries, change to new relationships.

results.title: Moorditji: Australian indigenous cultural expressions (PC & MAC) (A)
results.creator_credit: Moorditji Consortium, Australian Indigenous Cultural Expressions and The Moorditji Consortium
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Windows 95, 98 or 3.1/Mac OS 7.1 or higher. Featuring Aaron Pedersen and Justine Saunders as your guides, this CD Rom showcases the work of more than 100 of Australia’s Indigenous artists. Learn about different artists and aspects of Indigenous culture Australia wide by exploring this well presented and highly informative CD Rom. A tip: This CD Rom contains visual, audio and textual information about many Indigenous artists, some of whom are deceased. If you think these details may be distressing and you would like to hide this information about certain artists, choose the “List of Artists” options in the opening menu. A teacher’s guide accompanies the disc and covers the following areas: introduction; using Moorditji; links with curriculum framework; teaching strategies and terminology, planning a unit of work; general worksheets.

results.title: Moonwalk
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Dean Gitter Productions, Peretz Johnnes and Theo Kamecke
results.brief_description: A record of the journey that culminated in man’s first step on the moon, covering the spectacular blastoff, the lunar landing and the return to earth. Effective use of music, sound effects and slow motion. Includes images taken from inside the lunar module.

results.title: Moonstruck
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Patrick Palmer and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: A delightful romantic comedy which warms the heart. Cher plays Loretta Castorini, widowed at a young age due to “bad luck”. Engaged to timid Johnny Cammareri (Danny Aiello), Loretta attempts to mend the estrangement between Johnny and his brother Ronny. Instead, she falls in love with Ronny (Nicholas Cage). “Moonstruck” takes us into the hearts and minds of a loving Brooklyn-Italian family, sharing their dramas, tragedies and joys. “La bella Luna”, the moon, forms a romantic backdrop for the turbulent affairs of the heart and creates an atmosphere where anything can happen, and does! Co-starring Vincent Gardenia and Olympia Dukakis.

results.title: Moonraker (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Danjaq, Albert R. Broccoli, Lewis Gilbert and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: James Bond (Roger Moore) goes sci-fi in “Moonraker”, sourcing a missing space shuttle that has vanished in transit. A survey of the crash site reveals no evidence of the Moonraker; hijacking is the only explanation. Heading to California, Bond makes contact with billionaire Hugh Drax (Michael Lonsdale), head of Drax Industries and creator of the shuttle, as well NASA scientist and CIA Agent Dr Holly Goodhead (Lois Charles). Their paths cross again in Venice where Bond discovers a highly toxic nerve gas created from a rare orchid. The film culminates at a space station where a show down takes place with the megalomaniac Drax, intent on inflicting mass genocide and beginning a super race of perfect human specimens created in his image. Highlights include a centrifuge simulator, lethal Dobermans, a gondola chase, an out of control cable car and the return of the deadly steel-toothed killer, Jaws (Richard Kiel).

results.title: Moonlighting
results.creator_credit: Centar Film, Michael White, Mark Shivas and Jerzy Skolimowski
results.brief_description: Three Polish builders and their foreman, Nowak, (Jeremy Irons), the only one to speak English, enter Britain illegally to renovate the home of a rich fellow Pole. All goes according to plan, but it is December 1981, time of the military crackdown in Poland and Nowak, the only one to find out, decides not to tell the others. Things start to go badly wrong, the workers are restless, money begins to run out, and Nowak resorts to increasingly desperate measures to keep everything under control. A Cannes Film Festival award winner.

results.title: Moonchild
results.creator_credit: Anne Makepeace Productions and Anne Makepeace
results.brief_description: A dramatised re-enactment of the methods used by the Reverend Keith Moon’s Unification Church to brainwash young people into joining the church and carrying out its work. Actual ex-members of the group, who have now been deprogrammed, appear in the film as themselves, providing a frightening portrayal of their gradual conversion to the philosophy of the Moonies. Shows the deprogramming methods used by ex-Moonies on young people who still adhere to the beliefs of Keith Moon. An excellent insight into the power of group psychology, highlighting how vulnerable and aimless people can be easily controlled and exploited when removed from such support groups as family and friends. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Moonbird
results.brief_description: A colour cartoon of the fantasy of childhood. Two small boys, armed with rope, cage and bait, embark upon a night-time expedition to capture the nocturnal bird. A bird does finally appear. Making friends, the boys persuade the bird to go home with them. (Award: Venice)

results.title: Moon warriors [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Team Work Production House and Samo Hung
results.brief_description: Simple fisherman Fei (Andy Lau) finds himself caught up in an extraordinary situation after assisting fugitive Prince (Kenny Bee) and his bodyguard Hsien (Maggie Cheung) after they have been ambushed in the forest near his home. Unaware of their identities at first, he invites them to take refuge in his village, where he learns of the conflict that has driven the Prince into fleeing his ancestral home. The Prince, appreciative of Fei’s skill with a sword, asks him to accompany Hsien on a mission to rescue his betrothed, Princess Yuen (Anita Mui), and her father, the Emperor Lan-Ning Kwan. When they reach the Emperor and his daughter, they are confronted by a calculated surprise attack that leaves almost everyone except dead. A tangled web begins to unravel amidst the chaos, uncovering the devastating truth. An epic, atmospheric tale of rivalry, betrayal and revenge from legendary director Samo Hung, internationally renowned for creating original and aggressively acrobatic fight scenes in Hong Kong action films. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
